byline.original: By JACK HEALY and MATT FURBER

abstract: Somali community in Minneapolis is riven by convictions of handful of local young men for conspiring to join Islamic State; some doubt defendants' fervor, mistrust government and criticize those who helped investigation; others are eager to confront scourge of extremists who have made region into recruiting hotbed.
lead_paragraph: The convictions of three young men on federal terrorism charges have divided families and opinions in the nation’s largest Somali community.

headline.main: Justice or ‘Conspiracy’? Terrorism Trial Divides Somalis in Minneapolis
headline.print_headline: Fair or ‘Conspiracy’? Trial Divides Somalis in Minneapolis

snippet: The convictions of three young men on federal terrorism charges have divided families and opinions in the nation’s largest Somali community.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
